Animals¶

The animals module¶

This module provides classes implementing the animals on the Island.

class biosim.animals.Animal(properties)[source]¶

Parent class for herbivores and carnivores.

Initializing Animal class by asserting property values are valid.

Parameters:properties (dict) – Contains animal properties species, fitness, age and weight.
classmethod GET_DEFAULT_PARAMS()[source]¶

Returns a copy of the default animal parameters.

Returns:Copy of default animal parameters
Return type:dict
add_eaten_fodder_to_weight(fodder)[source]¶

Adds amount of weight to animals total body weight given by \(\beta \cdot F\). Also resets have_moved_this_year to False.

Parameters:fodder (float) – Amount of fodder available to the animal
birth_process(num_animals)[source]¶

If birth takes place, a birth weight is returned and weight of mother is reduced according to given formula. :returns birth_weight or None: float or None

Returns weight of the baby that is born, or None if no baby is born.
static convert_dict_to_list_and_array(moving_prob_for_each_loc)[source]¶

Converts dictionary with locations as keys and probabilities as values to a list of locations and a numpy array of probabilities. :param moving_prob_for_each_loc: dict

Contains the locations of each surrounding cell as keys, and the probabilities for the animal to move to each of them as values.
Returns:list, array List of locations of neighbouring cells, numpy array of the probabilities of moving to each.
find_fitness()[source]¶

Updates fitness. Fitness is zero if weight is zero, otherwise given by

\[\]

q^{+}(a, a_{fraq{1}{2}}, phi_{age}) cdot q^{-}(w, w_{fraq{1}{2}}, phi_{weight}

where

\[\]

q^{pm}(x, x_{fraq{1}{2}, phi) = fraq{1}{1 + e^{pm phi(x-x_{fraq{1}{2}})}

find_new_coordinates(neighbours_of_current_cell)[source]¶

Uses cumulative probability to decide which of the neighbouring cells the animal will move to. Returns the coordinates of that cell. :param neighbours_of_current_cell: dict

Neighbours of current cell. Locations as keys, instance of landscape class as value.
Returns:tuple The location the animal will move to.
find_rel_abund_of_fodder(landscape_cell)[source]¶

Takes an instance of a landscape class and returns the relative abundance of fodder in that instance, given by

\[\]

epsilon = fraq{f_k}{(n_k + 1)F^’}

Parameters:landscape_cell (dict) – Instance of landscape class
Returns:Relative abundance of fodder
Return type:float
make_animal_one_year_older()[source]¶

Adds 1 year to the age of the animal for each cycle.

prob_death()[source]¶

Finds probability of death, which depends on the fitness of the animal.

prob_give_birth(num_animals)[source]¶

Checks that weight of animal is more than given limit. If so, probability of giving birth is calculated from formula (8). :returns: prob

The probability for the animal to give birth.
prob_move_to_each_neighbour(neighbours_of_current_cell)[source]¶

Iterates through the dict of neighbours to the current cell. Finds the probability of moving to each of the neighbouring cells. Returns a dict mapping cell locations to the probability of moving there. :param neighbours_of_current_cell: dict

Neighbours of current cell. Locations as keys, instance of landscape class as value.
Returns:dict Locations of each surrounding cell as keys, probabilities for the animal to move to each of them as values.
prob_of_animal_moving()[source]¶

Computes the probability of moving at all, which depends on the animal’s fitness.

Returns:Probability of moving
Return type:float
propensity_move_to_each_neighbour(neighbours_of_current_cell)[source]¶

Finds the propensity for the animal to move to each of it’s neighbours.

Parameters:neighbours_of_current_cell – Contains neighbours of current cell. Location as keys, instance of landscape class as value
Type:dict
Returns:Maps location to it’s propensity.
Return type:dict
classmethod reset_params()[source]¶

Sets the animal parameters equal to default.

return_new_coordinates(neighbours_of_current_cell)[source]¶

Checks whether the animal will move or not, and if so, returns the new coordinates. :return: tuple or None

weight_loss()[source]¶

Substracts given amount of weight from the animals total weight after each cycle, given by \(\eta \cdot weight\).

will_animal_live()[source]¶

Checks the probability of death. Returns True if the animal lives. :return bool

will_animal_move()[source]¶

Compared probability of animal moving and a random number to decide whether the animal should move.

Returns:True if animal will move, False if not.
Return type:bool
will_birth_take_place(num_animals)[source]¶

Checks probability of giving birth and returns True if a baby is to be born. :returns bool

class biosim.animals.Herbivore(properties)[source]¶

Class for herbivores.

Initializes herbivore animal with given properties. :param properties: dict storing age, weight and fitness of herbivore

find_rel_abund_of_fodder(landscape_cell)[source]¶

Takes an instance of a landscape class, and returns the relative abundance of fodder for herbivores in that instance. :param landscape_cell: dict

Instance of landscape class
Returns:float
class biosim.animals.Carnivore(properties)[source]¶

Class for Carnivores.

Initializes carnivore animal with given properties. :param properties: dict storing age, weight and fitness of herbivore

eat(pop_herb)[source]¶

Iterates through list of herbivores, and implements kill method on one herbivore at the time until carnivore has satisfied it’s appetite or has tried to kill all herbivores without luck. :param pop_herb: list

List of herbivores available to the carnivore sorted by fitness
:return list
List of herbivores killed
find_rel_abund_of_fodder(landscape_cell)[source]¶

Takes an instance of a landscape class, and returns the relative abundance of fodder in that instance. :param landscape_cell: dict

Instance of landscape class
Returns:float
kill(herb)[source]¶

Implements prob_kill and a random number to decide whether a carnivore kills or not. :param herb: class ‘__main__.Herbivore’

Herbivore to be killed
Returns:bool
prob_kill(fitness_herb)[source]¶

Calculates the probability of a carnivore killing a herbivore.
